Components

Components are the building blocks of PhilJS applications. Learn how to create reusable, composable UI elements.

Basic Components

In PhilJS, components are just functions that return JSX:

1function Greeting() {
2  return <h1>Hello, World!</h1>;
3}
4 
5// Usage
6function App() {
7  return (
8    <div>
9      <Greeting />
10    </div>
11  );
12}

Props

Pass data to components using props:

1interface GreetingProps {
2  name: string;
3  age?: number;
4}
5 
6function Greeting(props: GreetingProps) {
7  return (
8    <div>
9      <h1>Hello, {props.name}!</h1>
10      {props.age && <p>You are {props.age} years old.</p>}
11    </div>
12  );
13}
14 
15// Usage
16<Greeting name="Alice" age={30} />
i

Props are Reactive

Props automatically update when their values change. You don't need to wrap them in signals.

Destructuring Props

1// Direct destructuring
2function Greeting({ name, age }: GreetingProps) {
3  return (
4    <div>
5      <h1>Hello, {name}!</h1>
6      {age && <p>You are {age} years old.</p>}
7    </div>
8  );
9}
10 
11// With defaults
12function Button({ label = 'Click me', onClick }: ButtonProps) {
13  return <button onClick={onClick}>{label}</button>;
14}
!

Destructuring Breaks Reactivity

Destructuring props early can break reactivity. If you need reactive props, destructure them inside your JSX or use props.value directly.

Children

1import { JSX } from 'philjs-core';
2 
3interface CardProps {
4  title: string;
5  children: JSX.Element;
6}
7 
8function Card(props: CardProps) {
9  return (
10    <div className="card">
11      <h2>{props.title}</h2>
12      <div className="card-content">
13        {props.children}
14      </div>
15    </div>
16  );
17}
18 
19// Usage
20<Card title="Welcome">
21  <p>This is the card content</p>
22  <button>Click me</button>
23</Card>

Render Props Pattern

1interface DataListProps<T> {
2  data: T[];
3  renderItem: (item: T, index: number) => JSX.Element;
4}
5 
6function DataList<T>(props: DataListProps<T>) {
7  return (
8    <ul>
9      <For each={props.data}>
10        {(item, index) => (
11          <li>{props.renderItem(item, index())}</li>
12        )}
13      </For>
14    </ul>
15  );
16}
17 
18// Usage
19<DataList
20  data={users()}
21  renderItem={(user, idx) => (
22    <div>
23      {idx + 1}. {user.name}
24    </div>
25  )}
26/>

Component State

1function Counter() {
2  const [count, setCount] = createSignal(0);
3 
4  return (
5    <div>
6      <p>Count: {count()}</p>
7      <button onClick={() => setCount(c => c + 1)}>
8        Increment
9      </button>
10    </div>
11  );
12}
13 
14// Complex state
15function TodoList() {
16  const [todos, setTodos] = createSignal<Todo[]>([]);
17  const [filter, setFilter] = createSignal<'all' | 'active'>('all');
18 
19  const filteredTodos = createMemo(() =>
20    filter() === 'all'
21      ? todos()
22      : todos().filter(t => !t.completed)
23  );
24 
25  return (
26    <div>
27      {/* ... */}
28    </div>
29  );
30}

Lifecycle

onMount

1import { onMount } from 'philjs-core';
2 
3function DataFetcher() {
4  const [data, setData] = createSignal(null);
5 
6  onMount(async () => {
7    const response = await fetch('/api/data');
8    const json = await response.json();
9    setData(json);
10  });
11 
12  return <div>{data() ? JSON.stringify(data()) : 'Loading...'}</div>;
13}

onCleanup

1import { onMount, onCleanup } from 'philjs-core';
2 
3function Timer() {
4  const [time, setTime] = createSignal(0);
5 
6  onMount(() => {
7    const interval = setInterval(() => {
8      setTime(t => t + 1);
9    }, 1000);
10 
11    // Cleanup function
12    onCleanup(() => {
13      clearInterval(interval);
14    });
15  });
16 
17  return <div>Time: {time()}s</div>;
18}

Refs

Access DOM elements directly using refs:

1function FocusInput() {
2  let inputRef: HTMLInputElement | undefined;
3 
4  const focus = () => {
5    inputRef?.focus();
6  };
7 
8  return (
9    <div>
10      <input ref={inputRef} type="text" />
11      <button onClick={focus}>Focus Input</button>
12    </div>
13  );
14}
15 
16// With callback ref
17function ScrollToBottom() {
18  const handleRef = (el: HTMLDivElement) => {
19    el.scrollTop = el.scrollHeight;
20  };
21 
22  return <div ref={handleRef}>{/* content */}</div>;
23}

Conditional Rendering

Show Component

1import { Show } from 'philjs-core';
2 
3function UserProfile() {
4  const [user, setUser] = createSignal<User | null>(null);
5 
6  return (
7    <Show
8      when={user()}
9      fallback={<p>Loading...</p>}
10    >
11      {(userData) => (
12        <div>
13          <h1>{userData.name}</h1>
14          <p>{userData.email}</p>
15        </div>
16      )}
17    </Show>
18  );
19}

Switch/Match Component

1import { Switch, Match } from 'philjs-core';
2 
3function StatusIndicator() {
4  const [status, setStatus] = createSignal<'loading' | 'success' | 'error'>('loading');
5 
6  return (
7    <Switch fallback={<p>Unknown status</p>}>
8      <Match when={status() === 'loading'}>
9        <Spinner />
10      </Match>
11      <Match when={status() === 'success'}>
12        <SuccessMessage />
13      </Match>
14      <Match when={status() === 'error'}>
15        <ErrorMessage />
16      </Match>
17    </Switch>
18  );
19}

Rendering Lists

For Component

1import { For } from 'philjs-core';
2 
3function TodoList() {
4  const [todos, setTodos] = createSignal<Todo[]>([]);
5 
6  return (
7    <ul>
8      <For each={todos()}>
9        {(todo, index) => (
10          <li>
11            {index() + 1}. {todo.text}
12          </li>
13        )}
14      </For>
15    </ul>
16  );
17}
i

Why Use For?

The For component is optimized for keyed lists. It only re-renders items that change, unlike map() which re-renders everything.

Index Component

1import { Index } from 'philjs-core';
2 
3// Use Index when items are primitives and order matters
4function ColorList() {
5  const [colors, setColors] = createSignal(['red', 'green', 'blue']);
6 
7  return (
8    <ul>
9      <Index each={colors()}>
10        {(color, index) => (
11          <li style={{ color: color() }}>
12            {index}: {color()}
13          </li>
14        )}
15      </Index>
16    </ul>
17  );
18}

Component Composition

Higher-Order Components

1function withLoading<P extends object>(
2  Component: (props: P) => JSX.Element
3) {
4  return (props: P & { loading: boolean }) => {
5    return (
6      <Show
7        when={!props.loading}
8        fallback={<Spinner />}
9      >
10        <Component {...props} />
11      </Show>
12    );
13  };
14}
15 
16// Usage
17const UserProfileWithLoading = withLoading(UserProfile);
18<UserProfileWithLoading user={user()} loading={isLoading()} />

Slots Pattern

1interface LayoutProps {
2  header: JSX.Element;
3  sidebar: JSX.Element;
4  children: JSX.Element;
5}
6 
7function Layout(props: LayoutProps) {
8  return (
9    <div className="layout">
10      <header>{props.header}</header>
11      <aside>{props.sidebar}</aside>
12      <main>{props.children}</main>
13    </div>
14  );
15}
16 
17// Usage
18<Layout
19  header={<Header />}
20  sidebar={<Sidebar />}
21>
22  <MainContent />
23</Layout>

Context

1import { createContext, useContext } from 'philjs-core';
2 
3interface ThemeContextType {
4  theme: Accessor<'light' | 'dark'>;
5  setTheme: Setter<'light' | 'dark'>;
6}
7 
8const ThemeContext = createContext<ThemeContextType>();
9 
10function ThemeProvider(props: { children: JSX.Element }) {
11  const [theme, setTheme] = createSignal<'light' | 'dark'>('light');
12 
13  const value = { theme, setTheme };
14 
15  return (
16    <ThemeContext.Provider value={value}>
17      {props.children}
18    </ThemeContext.Provider>
19  );
20}
21 
22// Usage in child components
23function ThemedButton() {
24  const context = useContext(ThemeContext);
25  if (!context) throw new Error('ThemeContext not found');
26 
27  return (
28    <button className={context.theme()}>
29      Current theme: {context.theme()}
30    </button>
31  );
32}

Error Boundaries

1import { ErrorBoundary } from 'philjs-core';
2 
3function App() {
4  return (
5    <ErrorBoundary
6      fallback={(err, reset) => (
7        <div>
8          <h1>Something went wrong</h1>
9          <pre>{err.message}</pre>
10          <button onClick={reset}>Try again</button>
11        </div>
12      )}
13    >
14      <MyComponent />
15    </ErrorBoundary>
16  );
17}

Dynamic Imports

1import { lazy } from 'philjs-core';
2 
3// Lazy load a component
4const HeavyComponent = lazy(() => import('./HeavyComponent'));
5 
6function App() {
7  return (
8    <Suspense fallback={<div>Loading...</div>}>
9      <HeavyComponent />
10    </Suspense>
11  );
12}

Best Practices

  1. Keep components small: Each component should do one thing well
  2. Use TypeScript: Define prop interfaces for better DX
  3. Avoid prop drilling: Use context for deeply nested state
  4. Memoize expensive computations: Use createMemo
  5. Clean up effects: Always use onCleanup for subscriptions
  6. Use semantic HTML: Maintain accessibility
